post: Debating Matters: Transatlantic includes a U. S. virtual qualifier and a 4-day London program where top U. S. students join U. K. peers for international deliberations on global issues. Its a once-in-a-lifetime chance to make friends across the pond and grow as leaders. Which rising debaters should consider this? Share DMTA with them. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4aWAHd8  #DebatingMatters  #DMTA  #YouthLeadership  #Debate  #GlobalCitizenship

[My students] still have their Pocket Constitutions when theyre seniors.  – Jeffrey M., California educator A single gift this year can stay with students for years to come. $1 = 1 Pocket Constitution for a student in your state. How will you champion civics as 2025 ends? Give now ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #TeacherVoices  #Philanthropy

One community problem, one student solution.  #NationalCivicsBee (grades 6-8) begins with a 4-question essay powered by BRI-written content. What issue would your students solve? Encourage students to apply by Feb. 3:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #MiddleSchool

The Debate & Leadership Institute (July 20-24, 2026) helps rising 10th-12th graders build real-world skills in public speaking, debate, teamwork, and civic leadership, culminating in a tournament at the Union League of Philadelphia. Many students can attend free of charge thanks to sponsorships. Which students in your network should consider applying? Share this with them. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3Z810qb  #DebateAndLeadershipInstitute  #YouthLeadership  #PublicSpeaking  #CivicEducation  #CollegeReady

Civics isnt abstract, its vital. In his end-of-year message, BRI President & CEO David Bobb shares why this work matters as we approach Americas 250th, and how donors keep our resources free for teachers. Share with a colleague. December is a natural moment for reflection. One short theme-aligned activity, such as journaling, discussion, or a quick civic connection, can help students reflect on civic identity as the semester ends. Log it to enter Decembers Civic Star drawings. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicLearning  #CivicEducation  #America250  #TeachingResources

Debating Matters: Transatlantic emphasizes substance over style, with students judged on the strength of their research and arguments, not just performance. Through international debates, they practice listening, empathy, and rigorous thinking with peers from the U. S. and U. K. Were grateful for the support of Carnegie Corporation of New York in helping make this transatlantic program possible. Know a student who would grow from this kind of challenge? Share this opportunity. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4aWAHd8  #DebatingMatters  #DMTA  #CivicEducation  #CriticalThinking  #PublicSpeaking

Celebrate Americas 250th all year with BRIs 2026 A250 Calendar! 12 months of American Portraits lessons plus primary sources from the Declaration, Constitution, and Bill of Rights. Some of the most meaningful gifts students give arent wrapped; theyre the positive change they create. Encourage a student to share their civic-impact story through the MyImpact Challenge. Learn more:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #YouthLeadership  #CivicEngagement  #ServiceLearning

At NCSS in Washington, D. C., BRI connected with social studies educators around BRI Jr., our Government and Politics: Civics for the American Experiment curriculum, tabletop games, and more, alongside partners like iCivics and the Civic Star Challenge.
